channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China exports skyrocket over 12% in March as trade war drives businesses to frontload shipments
item.description: China has set an ambitious growth target of "around 5%" — a goal seen harder to achieve given the prospects of an escalating trade war and weak domestic consumption

item.title: Hong Kong shares rise over 2%, leading gains in Asia-Pacific after Trump pauses tariffs on consumer electronics
item.description: Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index up 2.52% and Hang Seng Tech Index trading 2.98% higher.

item.title: China urges Trump to correct mistakes and heed 'rational voices' on reciprocal tariffs
item.description: China's Commerce Ministry called tariff exemptions a "small step" but urged the U.S. to "completely abolish" reciprocal tariffs.

item.title: Like defense, Goldman says ESG investors should bring oil and gas stocks in from the cold
item.description: Tobacco giants, fossil fuel companies and weapons makers have typically been among those to have been excluded from sustainable portfolios.

item.title: Stock futures rise after a wild week as traders weigh surprise China tariff exemption: Live updates
item.description: The moves come after the market saw one of the most volatile trading weeks ever last week.

item.title: Could Trump’s tariffs spark a commodities super-cycle? Market watchers are divided
item.description: One strategist said certain commodities “will go way higher than most people will be willing to believe.”

item.title: Singapore eases monetary policy for a second time; slashes GDP forecast after growth misses estimates
item.description: This comes as the MAS had previously eased its policy stance back in its January meeting, the first time since 2020.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Tech tariff exemption suggests the importance of consumers
item.description: The Trump administration exempted electronics from "reciprocal" tariffs. It's a relief for consumers, who desperately need an uplift in mood.

item.title: Japan policymaker wants stronger yen, says Tokyo shouldn't sell Treasuries
item.description: Japan should not intentionally sell its U.S. Treasury holdings in retaliation against tariffs levied by President Donald Trump, official says.

item.title: Chinese exchanges restrict daily stock sales as trade war with U.S. escalates, Reuters reports
Baby boomers and first-time travelers are shunning Europe’s summer hotspots in favor of 'coolcations'
item.description: A growing wave of holidaymakers appear to be prioritizing summer trips to northern Europe to escape the heat.

item.title: 30-year-old influencer made $4 million in sales by creating a luxury hair oil brand rooted in Indian traditions
item.description: Hair-oiling is an ancient Indian tradition that has recently become a social media trend, with almost half a million TikTok posts under the hashtag #hairoil.

item.title: Billionaire Ray Dalio: 'I'm worried about something worse than a recession'
item.description: Bridgewater founder Ray Dalio said that he is worried about a breakdown of the global monetary order.

item.title: Here’s how much a ‘Made in the USA’ iPhone would cost
item.description: The White House says President Trump believes Apple can make a U.S. iPhone, but there are many reasons why analysts say that's likely not possible.

item.title: Register now: Applications open for the world's top fintech companies of 2025 list
item.description: For the third year in a row, CNBC is working with market research firm Statista to list the world's top financial technology companies.

item.title: Sports teams adopt tactile tech for blind and low-vision fans
item.description: Professional sports teams are partnering with startups to introduce technology for blind and visually impaired fans to better experience live games.

item.title: How China's exporters are scrambling to mitigate the impact of punishing U.S. tariffs
item.description: For China's exporters, trying to mitigate new U.S. tariffs means raising prices for Americans while diversifying where possible, at home and abroad.

item.title: Trump, top aides fuel tariff confusion by questioning reciprocal exemptions
item.description: Financial markets have been whipsawed as the Trump administration alters its tariff plans.

item.title: Five Chinese AI plays that could ride out trade war volatility
item.description: While U.S.-China trade tensions rock markets, analysts predict a handful of Chinese companies could win out on Beijing's efforts to double down on AI.

item.title: Trump tariffs on China will soon bring 'irreversible' damage to many American businesses
item.description: Apple's iPhone and other tech got a reprieve from Trump's China tariffs policy, but most businesses will soon face 'irreversible' damage from the trade war.

item.title: China unlikely to aggressively devalue yuan to offset impact of U.S. tariffs, economists say
item.description: Among the 11 analysts polled by CNBC, the majority do not see the currency weakening significantly, but rather a gradual depreciation engineered by the PBoC.

item.title: Magnificent Seven stocks are attracting some interest after falling to pre-ChatGPT valuations
item.description: Growing macroeconomic headwinds have investors picking their positions carefully.

item.title: Investors are growing concerned about a U.S. asset exodus as Treasurys and the dollar decline
item.description: The combined decline of U.S. stocks, bonds and the dollar could be a sign of a broader shift away from investing in America.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine accuse each other of failing to pause strikes after U.S. envoy leaves Moscow
item.description: Moscow and Kyiv both agreed in principle last month to implement a limited, 30-day ceasefire, but they each allege near-immediate breaches by the other side.

item.title: As U.S. and Iran look to begin nuclear talks amid fresh sanctions, can there be a deal?
item.description: Tehran has said the discussions in Oman over the weekend will be indirect after President Donald Trump made a surprise announcement earlier this week of “direct” negotiations.

item.title: Convalescing Pope Francis opens Holy Week with in-person greeting in St. Peter's Square
item.description: A convalescing Pope Francis greeted the crowd in St. Peter's Square on Palm Sunday, in yet another reassuring public sign of his recovery.

item.title: Sports and esports leaders talk boosting fanbases, growth opportunities and the role of tech
item.description: Leaders from sports and esports discuss the big opportunities and trends shaping growth in the multi-billion-dollar sector.

item.title: Authoritarian vs. authoritative: The difference between the 2 parenting styles, and which experts recommend to raise successful kids
item.description: The difference between authoritarian and authoritative parenting is stark and each have very different long and short-term effects on children.

item.title: U.S. won't say whether it's facilitating return of mistakenly deported man, despite judge's order
item.description: The Trump administration confirmed Saturday that a Maryland man who was mistakenly deported last month remains confined in a notorious prison in El Salvador.

item.title: Here are 10 countries with the highest concentration of AI talent globally, according to new LinkedIn data
item.description: Israel, Singapore and Luxembourg are among those with the highest concentration of AI talent compared to the 2024 global average, new LinkedIn data states.
